titlestmt.titleproper: Byllye Avery Collection, 1937-1997 Special Collection BA
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to her Holdings at the Black Film Center/Archive
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Mary Huelsbeck/Hannah Caproon/Gabriel Gardner

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:01:56 -0400.

did.unittitle: Byllye Avery Collection
did.abstract: Video and audio prints related to the making of On Becoming a Woman.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1981, Byllye Avery (b. 1937) founded the National Black Women's Health Project (NBWHP) in Atlanta, Georgia. As Director of this national and international health advocacy organization, one of Avery's projects was the production of the film in this collection, On Becoming a Woman: Mothers and Daughters Talking to Each Other (1987). The documentary film depicts two generations of African American women engaged in discussions about menstruation, sex, love, and communication.

In addition to her work at the NBWHP, Avery co-founded the Gainesville Women's Health Center and BIRTHPLACE, an alternative birthing center in Gainesville, Florida; wrote a preface for The New Our Bodies, Our Selves (1997); and advocated the Walking for Wellness Program, where women make a commitment to walk together twice a week. In 1989, Avery was named a MacArthur Fellow and in 1994, she received the Gustav O. Lienhard Award for the advancement of health care for her pioneering efforts to improve heath care for black and underserved women in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The BFC/A Byllye Avery Collection contains the final print of On Becoming a Woman as well as audio and visual outtakes and work prints from the film. These materials were donated to the BFC/A by Byllye Avery, whose resume, biography, and photograph are included in this collection.

The items outlined in this guide are listed according to the titles that were on the containers received by the BFC/A. The following descriptions of each item include information present on the film stock as well as notes about content and running time when available.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in August 1996.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], Byllye Avery Collection, Special Collection BA, Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.

sound effects (lab tape: 341/12 66 396 27225 107)
outtakes sound
misc. sound for effects including:
clothes rustling; various cartoons and TV show theme songs ("Love Boat," "Rawhide"); dialogue from movies, TV and cartoons; water sounds; "boiling water"; "we sponge"; "bodies coming together in intercourse"; "jelly on diaphragm"; "sperm trying to get through diaphragm"; "sperm trying to get through cervical cap"; "placing diaphragm"; "gushing jelly sounds"; "placing condom on penis"; Wild Track Byllye & Sonya; more TV/cartoon sounds; "orgasm zip sounds"; windchimes; projector sound; dialogue from "The Young and the Restless"
Roll ends at 30 minutes

audio q: good to fair
